intro: Trimezia capitellata, commonly known as the white-flowered trimezia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its upright, strap-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with partial to full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its elegant appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season. Trimezia capitellata is relatively low maintenance and suitable for both garden beds and container planting.
